IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: EDEN THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY IS A GRADUATE SCHOOL FOR INDIVIDUALS WISHING TO EARN HIGHER LEVEL DEGREES IN THE STUDY OF THEOLOGY, PREPARING MANY FOR THE PRACTICE OF MINISTRY. THE SCHOOL ALSO PROVIDES CONTINUING EDUCATION FOR CLERGY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: EDEN THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY IS A GRADUATE SCHOOL FOR INDIVIDUALS WISHINGTO EARN HIGHER LEVEL DEGREES IN THE STUDY OF THEOLOGY, PREPARING MANYFOR THE PRACTICE OF MINISTRY. THE SCHOOL ALSO PROVIDES CONTINUINGEDUCATION FOR CLERGY.
IRS990.Desc: EDEN SEMINARY HAD 106 STUDENTS IN OUR MASTER OF DIVINITY PROGRAM, 0 INOUR MASTER OF ARTS IN PASTORAL STUDIES PROGRAM, 12 IN OUR MASTER OFTHEOLOGICAL STUDIES PROGRAM, AND 30 IN OUR DOCTOR OF MINISTRY DEGREEPROGRAM. WE ALSO HAD 5 PEOPLE WHO WERE ENROLLED AS CREDIT NON-DEGREESTUDENTS. OUR GRADUATING CLASS THIS YEAR INCLUDED 20 INDIVIDUALSEARNING A MASTER OF DIVINITY DEGREE, 0 EARNING A MASTER OF ARTS INPASTORAL SUDIES DEGREE, 5 EARNING A MASTER OF THEOLOGICAL STUDIESDEGREE, AND 4 EARNING A DOCTOR OF MINISTRY DEGREE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE HELD IN PERPETUITY. THE EARNINGS ON INVESTMENT ARE USED IN SUPPORT OF THE SEMINARY MISSION.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT-INTEREST AGREEMENTS 46,433.
SCHOLARSHIPS 1,015,236.
SCHOLARSHIPS 1,015,236. ROUNDING
SEE PART II

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE E, LINE 3 - EXPLANATION OF NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SEMINARY DISCLOSES ITS NON-DISCRIMINATION POLICY TO THE PUBLIC VIA ITS WEBSITE. THE DISCRIMINATION POLICY IS ALSO GIVEN TO ALL STUDENTS AT REGISTRATION AS PART OF THE STUDENT HANDBOOK.

EDEN THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY IS RESPONSIBLE FOR COLLECTING FINANCIAL AID FOR ITS QUALIFYING STUDENTS AND EITHER DISTRIBUTING THIS AID TO THOSE STUDENTS OR APPLYING THE AID TOWARDS TUITION, FEES, ETC. THE SEMINARY MAKES STAFFORD LOANS AVAILABLE FOR ELIGIBLE STUDENTS.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: TUITION AND HOUSING GRANTS TO STUDENTS OF EDEN THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EDEN THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY AWARDS TUITION GRANTS TO ITS STUDENTS. THE GRANTS REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF TUITION AND FEES THAT THAT STUDENT IS REQUIRED TO PAY TO THE SEMINARY. THE SEMINARY MAINTAINS RECORDS OF THE GRANTS AWARDED TO THE STUDENTS.
AS CLERGY, THE PRESIDENT HAS A CERTAIN PORTION OF HIS COMPENSATION DESIGNATED AS HOUSING ALLOWANCE.
THE MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD MEETS ANNUALLY
EDEN CONTRACTS WITH THE MONETA GROUP TO MANAGE ITS INVESTMENTS AND PROCESS DONATIONS OF STOCK AND SECURITIES THROUGH CHARLES SCHWAB.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DAVID SAUERHOFF - FAMILY RELATIONSHIP TIMOTHY LUEHRMAN - FAMILY RELATIONSHIP

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD IS SELF-PERPETUATING AND ELECTS ALL NEW BOARD MEMBERS. FACULTY REPRESENTATIVE IS NOMINATED BY THE FACULTY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PRESIDENT AND CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER WILL REVIEW THE 990 PRIOR TO SIGNING THE DOCUMENT. THEY WILL REVIEW THE INFORMATION TO DETERMINE THAT INFORMATION IN THE 990, TO THE BEST OF THEIR KNOWLEDGE, IS COMPLETE AND ACCURATE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IT IS THE POLICY OF EDEN THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY THAT NO EMPLOYEE, OFFICER OR BOARD MEMBER SHALL ENTER INTO ANY BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP WITH ANY OTHER PERSON OR ENTITY WHICH MAY CREATE A CONFLICT BETWEEN THAT RELATIONSHIP AND THEIR DUTIES TO EDEN. FURTHER, NO EMPLOYEE, OFFICER OR BOARD MEMBER SHALL PLACE HER/HIMSELF IN A POSITION IN WHICH PERSONAL INTEREST, FINANCIAL OR OTHERWISE, MIGHT INFLUENCE OR BE PERCEIVED TO INFLUENCE ANY ACTION SHE/HE MAY TAKE OR ADVICE SHE/HE MAY RENDER ON BEHALF OF EDEN. SOME EMPLOYEES AND ALL OFFICERS AND BOARD MEMBERS, UPON HIRE/APPOINTMENT AND ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, WILL BE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE FROM DISCLOSING POTENTIAL CONFLICTS. IN ADDITION, ALL OFFICERS AND BOARD MEMBERS HAVE AN ONGOING DUTY TO BRING TO THE ATTENTION OF EDEN SITUATIONS WHICH MAY GIVE RISE TO AN ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST DESCRIBED IN THIS POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DURING THE BUDGETING PROCESS, THE FINANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS MANAGEMENT'S RECOMMENDATION FOR PAY INCREASES. THE PAY INCREASES FOR THE PRESIDENT, KEY EMPLOYEES AND FACULTY IS DETERMINED IN RELATION TO SALARY INFORMATION GATHERED BY THE ASSOCIATION OF THEOLOGICAL SCHOOLS. MANAGEMENT HAS PROPOSED RAISES IN SALARIES BASED ON ACROSS THE BOARD PERCENTAGE RATE FOR ALL STAFF AND FACULTY EXCEPT THE PRESIDENT. WHEN THE FINANCE COMMITTEE APPROVES THE BUDGET AND SALARY INCREASES, IT IS PRESENTED TO THE FULL BOARD FOR ADOPTION. THE PRESIDENT'S SALARY IS PROPOSED TO THE BOARD BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AS PART OF ITS ANNUAL REVIEW OF THE PRESIDENT'S PERFORMANCE. STAFF ARE EVALUATED ANNUALLY, BUT PAY RAISES ARE NOT TIED TO EVALUATIONS. FACULTY ARE EVALUATED ACCORDING TO THE FACULTY MANUAL, BUT AGAIN, PAY RAISES ARE NOT TIED TO EVALUATIONS. THE LAST RAISES BY THE ORGANIZATION WERE IN JULY 2017.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST TO THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE.
OUTSIDE SERVICES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 192,829. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 469,335. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 17,518. TOTAL EXPENSES 679,682.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT-INTEREST AGREEMENTS 46,433. ROUNDING

FINANCIAL STATEMENT AND REPORTING: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT. THIS IS CONSISTENT WITH PRIOR YEARS.
